summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between attorney Michael Bachner and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss the status of the Epstein investigation. The emails show attempts to coordinate a meeting date in early August 2019.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney at Bachner & Associates, P.C. who is being contacted by an Assistant U.S. Attorney to schedule a meeting regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is attempting to schedule a meeting with attorney Michael Bachner to discuss the status of the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is attempting to schedule a meeting with attorney Michael Bachner to discuss the Epstein investigation, indicating professional contact between prosecution and defense counsel.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: Michael Bachner proposes August 14, 2019 as a potential date to meet with the Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Failed Meeting Attempt
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney's office tried to reach Michael Bachner's office but was unable to connect, prompting a request to reschedule.

events.title: Follow-up Request
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up on previous discussions and a meeting from the week before last, requesting a status discussion about the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: Attorney Michael Bachner was in communication with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein investigation in July-August 2019.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York was actively pursuing a meeting to discuss the status of the Epstein investigation.
Multiple scheduling attempts were made between July 31 and August 7, 2019, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to the Epstein case.
The correspondence shows professional legal communication between defense counsel and prosecutors during the investigation period.
The emails contain confidentiality notices referencing the Electronic Communications Privacy Act, indicating sensitive legal discussions.
